info.description: The Shutterstock API provides access to Shutterstock's library of media, as well as information about customers' accounts and the contributors that provide the media.
info.title: Shutterstock API Explorer

parameters.description: One or more audio IDs
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: Amount of detail to render in the response
parameters.name: view

get.description: This endpoint lists information about one or more audio tracks, including the description and publication date.

parameters.description: Page number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: per_page

get.description: This endpoint lists your collections of audio tracks and their basic attributes.

parameters.description: Collection metadata
parameters.name: body

post.description: This endpoint creates one or more collections (soundboxes). To add tracks, use `POST /v2/audio/collections/{id}/items`.

x-code-samples.source:
DATA='{
  "name": "Best rock music"
}'

curl -X POST https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/audio/collections \
-d "$DATA" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN"

parameters.description: Collection ID
parameters.name: id

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X DELETE https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/audio/collections/48433111 \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN"

parameters.description: Collection ID
parameters.name: id

get.description: This endpoint gets more detailed information about a collection, including the number of items in it and when it was last updated. To get the tracks in collections, use `GET /v2/audio/collections/{id}/items`.

get.description: This endpoint searches for tracks. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/audio/search" \
--header "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "query=bluegrass" \
--data-urlencode "duration_from=60" \
--data-urlencode "moods=uplifting"

parameters.description: The image data as a base64 string
parameters.name: body

post.description: This endpoint uploads an image for reverse image or video search. Images must be in JPEG or PNG format. To get the search results, pass the upload ID that this endpoint returns to the GET /v2/cv/similar/images or GET /v2/cv/similar/videos endpoints. Contact us for access to this endpoint.

x-code-samples.source:
RESPONSE=$(curl -X POST 'https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/cv/images' \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d "{\"base64_image\":\"`base64 myImage.jpg`\"}")

echo "The next step requires the jq program."

UPLOAD_ID=$(jq -r .upload_id <<< $RESPONSE)

curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/cv/similar/images \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "asset_type=images" \
--data-urlencode "asset_id=$UPLOAD_ID"

get.description: This endpoint searches for editorial images. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/editorial/search \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-G \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
--data-urlencode "query=football" \
--data-urlencode "country=USA" \
--data-urlencode "sort=newest" \
--data-urlencode "date_start=2018-10-23"

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: country

get.description: This endpoint searches for images. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT. Free API accounts show results only from a limited library of media, not the full Shutterstock media library. Also, the number of search fields they can use in a request is limited.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/images/search \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "query=Vienna" \
--data-urlencode "orientation=horizontal" \
--data-urlencode "sort=popular"

parameters.description: Show images that were added, deleted, or edited; by default, the endpoint returns images that were updated in any of these ways
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Show images updated on or after the specified date, in the format YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: Show images updated before the specified date, in the format YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Show images updated in the specified time period, where the time period is an interval (like SQL INTERVAL) such as 1 DAY, 6 HOUR, or 30 MINUTE; the default is 1 HOUR, which shows images that were updated in the hour preceding the request
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: Page number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page, defaults to 100
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Sort order
parameters.name: sort

get.description: This endpoint lists images that have been updated in the specified time period to update content management systems (CMS) or digital asset management (DAM) systems. In most cases, use the `interval` parameter to show images that were updated recently, but you can also use the `start_date` and `end_date` parameters to specify a range of no more than three days. Do not use the `interval` parameter with either `start_date` or `end_date`.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/images/updated \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "interval=30 MINUTE"

get.description: This endpoint returns images that are visually similar to an image that you specify.

client_id.description: Client ID (Consumer Key) of your application

client_secret.description: Client Secret (Consumer Secret) of your application

code.description: Response code from the /oauth/authorize flow; required if grant_type=authorization_code

expires.description: Whether or not the token expires, expiring tokens come with a refresh_token to renew the access_token

grant_type.description: Grant type: authorization_code generates user tokens, client_credentials generates short-lived client grants

post.description: This endpoint returns an access token for the specified user and with the specified scopes. The token does not expire until the user changes their password. The body parameters must be encoded as form data.

x-code-samples.source: curl "https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/oauth/access_token" \ -X POST \ --data-urlencode "client_id=860bde70bb335163e2e4" \ --data-urlencode "client_secret=225d245d28e5b1a37db7fd4ceb8cdf360a3ae5a7" \ --data-urlencode "grant_type=authorization_code" \ --data-urlencode "code=VaRLQ3rICmWjGr4ciI-GwR"

parameters.description: Client ID (Consumer Key) of your application
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: User type to be authorized (usually 'customer')
parameters.name: realm

parameters.description: The callback URI to send the request to after authorization; must use a host name that is registered with your application
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: Type of temporary authorization code that will be used to generate an access code; the only valid value is 'code'
parameters.name: response_type

parameters.description: Space-separated list of scopes to be authorized
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: Unique value used by the calling app to verify the request

302.description: Redirect user to authenticate with Shutterstock

get.description: This endpoint returns a redirect URI (in the 'Location' header) that the customer uses to authorize your application and, together with POST /v2/oauth/access_token, generate an access token that represents that authorization.

x-code-samples.source: curl "https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/oauth/authorize" \ -X GET \ -G \ --data-urlencode "scope=licenses.create licenses.view purchases.view" \ --data-urlencode "state=demo_`date +%s`" \ --data-urlencode "response_type=code" \ --data-urlencode "redirect_uri=http://localhost:3000/callback" \ --data-urlencode "client_id=860bde70bb335163e2e4"

post.description: This endpoint creates one or more collections (clipboxes). To add videos to collections, use `POST /v2/videos/collections/{id}/items`.

x-code-samples.source:
DATA='{
  "name": "New collection name"
}'

curl -X POST https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/videos/collections \
-d "$DATA" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN"

parameters.description: The ID of the collection to delete
parameters.name: id

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X DELETE https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/videos/collections/17555176 \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN"

parameters.description: The ID of the collection to return
parameters.name: id

get.description: This endpoint searches for videos. If you specify more than one search parameter, the API uses an AND condition. Array parameters can be specified multiple times; in this case, the API uses an AND or an OR condition with those values, depending on the parameter. You can also filter search terms out in the `query` parameter by prefixing the term with NOT.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/videos/search" \
--header "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "query=hot air balloon" \
--data-urlencode "duration_from=30" \
--data-urlencode "sort=popular"

parameters.description: Show videos updated on or after the specified date, in the format YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: Show videos updated before the specified date, in the format YYYY-MM-DD
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Show videos updated in the specified time period, where the time period is an interval (like SQL INTERVAL) such as 1 DAY, 6 HOUR, or 30 MINUTE; the default is 1 HOUR, which shows videos that were updated in the hour preceding the request
parameters.name: interval

parameters.description: Page number
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Number of results per page
parameters.name: per_page

parameters.description: Sort by oldest or newest videos first
parameters.name: sort

get.description: This endpoint lists videos that have been updated in the specified time period to update content management systems (CMS) or digital asset management (DAM) systems. In most cases, use the `interval` parameter to show videos that were updated recently, but you can also use the `start_date` and `end_date` parameters to specify a range of no more than three days. Do not use the `interval` parameter with either `start_date` or `end_date`.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X GET https://api.shutterstock.com/v2/videos/updated \
-H "Accept: application/json" \
-H "Authorization: Bearer $SHUTTERSTOCK_API_TOKEN" \
-G \
--data-urlencode "interval=30 MINUTE"

scopes.collections.edit: Grant the ability to create new collections, edit a collection, and modify the contents of a collection
scopes.collections.view: Grant read-only access to a collection and its contents.
scopes.earnings.view: Grant the ability to view a user's current earnings and payouts.
scopes.licenses.create: Grant the ability to download and license media on behalf of the user.
scopes.media.edit: Grant the ability to make changes to a user's existing approved media.
scopes.media.submit: Grant the ability to submit a user's uploaded media for review and check their approval states.
scopes.media.upload: Grant the ability to upload media to a user's account.
scopes.user.address: Grants read-only access to a user's physical address.
scopes.user.edit: Grants read and write access to all user account information.
scopes.user.email: Grants read-only access to a user's email address.
scopes.user.view: Grants read-only access to a user's basic account information (includes username, id, first and last name). If email is the same as username, it also implies user.email

scopes.collections.edit: Grant the ability to create new collections, edit a collection, and modify the contents of a collection
scopes.collections.view: Grant read-only access to a collection and its contents.
scopes.licenses.create: Grant the ability to download and license media on behalf of the user.
scopes.licenses.view: Grant read-only access to a user's licenses.
scopes.purchases.view: Grant read-only access to a user's purchase history.
scopes.user.view: Grants read-only access to a user's basic account information (includes username, id, first and last name). If email is the same as username, it also implies user.email
